subject: Re: [junit] Problem with simple test case
msgSnippet: ... Again, I recommend going to the Cactus Yahoo! group for more answers. ... I recommend this instead: public void testDoGet() throws Exception { HelloWorld
messageBody:
npitchika wrote:

> Hello there,
>
> I have a simple hello world servlet and a test case for it as
> follows:

Again, I recommend going to the Cactus Yahoo! group for more answers.

> *********************TEST CASE BEGIN*********************
> public class HelloWorldTest extends ServletTestCase{
>
> public void testDoGet() {
> HelloWorld hw = new HelloWorld();
> try {
> hw.doGet(request,response);
> }catch (Exception e) { }
> }

I recommend this instead:

public void testDoGet() throws Exception {
HelloWorld hw = new HelloWorld();
hw.doGet(request,response);
}

I am assuming that, if doGet() throws an exception, you do /not/ want
your test case to /pass/.

--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
